reviews.review:
Half-Life Blue Shift lives in the shadows of Opposing Force and the original game, but it is still fun. There are a lot of problems, and the game is very short, but in many ways this is exactly what the game's target audience wants: more Half-Life. Know the problems, but otherwise this is worth its price (at least if it's on sale).

PROS:
- All the great weapons and enemies from Half-Life
- Great level design with an actually fun Xen level
- Expectedly great performance
- Has more frequent and engaging "Valve" puzzles (could be a con to some)

CONS:
- Uninspired and boring storyline when compared to the original and Opposing Force
- Extremely short, taking little more than 2 hours to complete on a first time playthrough
- Introduces HD models that feel out of place, though they can be disabled
- Build is more unstable than the original game with somewhat frequent crashes
mis gibi oyun 4.5 saatlik eğlence sundu bana almanızı tavsiye ederim

Half-Life was brilliant. It revolutionized the first person shooter, provided hours of entertainment, introduced us to a world of weapons and bizarre creatures, and most importantly- it stayed with its plot throughout the game.
Barely functional first major puzzle

First problem. it's short. Like your first playthrough is over in maybe two hours short. And half of that time is spent figuring out the buggy aspects of it. If you do buy it, a great timesaver to know... F6 to quicksave, and F7 to quick load, you'll need it. Also, if you jump onto a ladder, you wont grab it if still holding space. That wasted over half an hour for me.

Now, the game itself isn't... bad... but it's not great or anything, again, it's got some issues and sticky moments in the gameplay or logic puzzles that are kind of jumps from what it set up before then. So there is frustrating moments. The basics of the story and experience is kind of interesting... but honestly there's just so little story or stuff here it's barely worth playing for extra half life lore (the reason I got it). So, not bad... but not good, and super insanely short to the point that even five dollars I payed feels like too much for this bite size bit of a game. Many demos have more content than this entire game did.

Half-Life: Blue Shift, the second & final expansion to the original Half-Life. Taking the role of Barney Calhoun, a security guard from Black Mesa who like Gordon, starts his day at work as usual, until the infamous Resonance Cascade occurred causing him to fight his way through Xen creatures, along with fighting marines. Once again, there story is very very similar to Half-Life & Half-Life: Opposing Force, but unlike those two this game is much shorter than usual. The game also appears to be much easier during my play through. For all 3 games I played on Hard Difficulty & noticed this was the easier of the 3. Game play remains the same as the other 2, graphics & sound are starting to feel out dated mainly because this came out in 2001, while Half-Life was released in 1998, & Opposing force in 1999. Still it's still a great game & I recommend playing this along Half-Life 1 & Opposing Force. 7/10

I was only twenty four years old. I loved Half Life so much, I had all the merchandise and movies. I'd pray to Barney Calhoun every night before I go to bed, thanking for the life I've been given. "Barney Calhoun is love", I would say, "Barney Calhoun is life". My dad hears me and calls me a fool. I knew he was just jealous for my devotion of Barney Calhoun. I called him a fool. He slaps me and sends me to go to sleep. I'm crying now and my face hurts. I lay in bed and it's really cold. A warmth is moving towards me. I feel something touch me. It's Barney Calhoun. I'm so happy. He whispers in my ear, "This is my Black Mesa research facility". He grabs me with his powerful securitymen hands, and puts me on my hands and knees. I spread my Wrench for Barney Calhoun. He penetrates my Wall. It crumbles so much, but I do it for Barney Calhoun. I can feel my wall tearing as my eyes start to water. I push against his opposing force. I want to please Barney Calhoun. He roars a mighty roar, as he fills my wall with his wrench. My dad walks in. Barney Calhoun looks him straight in the eye, and says, "It's all securitymen now". Barney Calhoun leaves through my window. Barney Calhoun is love. Barney Calhoun is life.﻿

Maybe it is because I am older, maybe because I am more picky, maybe it is because I want more of a story, maybe it is the old graphics, maybe it is the janky controls. At this point, the appeal of the original Half Life games to me seems to be mostly nostalgia and the attractiveness of the premise rather than the actual game. I enjoyed all the Half Life games as they progressively came out over the decades. Trying to go back to the original Half Life after seeing the upgrades in Half Life: Alyx showcases how far games have come since the early 2000s. Too bad the team who did Black Mesa did not also remake Blue Shift and Opposing Force to allow modern game-preferring audiences these games.

half life: blue shift is the 3rd half life game ( laugh emoji )
it's nothing unique, same as the 2 other half life games only there are less weapons, enemies, levels and variety
i finished this game in less than 4 hours and i managed to stumble upon - a pistol, a rifle, a shotgun, a rpg and 2 types of grenades.
even half life 2 had more weapons!!!
there is no final boss battle like the previous games, the game just ends.... 
the level design and story are terrible and messy.
the biggest problem this game has is it's age. the game relies heavily on map items & objectives so since the textures are so old you have no idea what to do. if the textures were newer i would've completed this game in 2 hours.
the only good thing going for this game is that at certain times the lack of weapons and resources is quite interesting - you're not gordon freeman, you don't have an HEV suit so obviously you can't refill your armor with HEV stations, you only have access to a limited arsenal of weapons which are realistic weapons and not crazy alien shit - health, armor and ammo are quite rare, but noone plays half life for realism or semi survival elements
if valve or some valve fanboy remakes the HL1 expansions, they better sell them in one package or it will be a scam.

this game was super dark and overall frustrating to play. even though it was short, about half my playtime was because of 2 "puzzles" that had stupidly cryptic solutions and one point where I thought the game had been softlocked because some elevator didn't work. It didn't work because there was a dead headcrab in the way (off to the right, clipping under the lift, barely visible). I might've seen this and fixed it in 15 seconds instead of 20 minutes if the game wasn't so FUCKING DARK and I could SEE. play half-life 1 or opposing force, this is not worth your money
